text:
Hi, the manual says that "Default Makie has the `slider`, `button` and `textslider` functions." but trying to use them gives:
```julia> using AbstractPlotting: textslider
ERROR: UndefVarError: textslider not defined```
I'm using AbstractPlotting v0.15.12, GLMakie v0.1.25, Makie v0.12.0

elements.text: Hi, the manual says that "Default Makie has the
functions." but trying to use them gives:

julia> using AbstractPlotting: textslider
ERROR: UndefVarError: textslider not defined
I'm using AbstractPlotting v0.15.12, GLMakie v0.1.25, Makie v0.12.0

text:
Not sure about `textslider`, but you should be able to use `AbstractPlotting.Slider` and `AbstractPlotting.Button` (note the capitalization).

This documentation may help you <https://makie.juliaplots.org/stable/makielayout/layoutables_examples.html>

elements.text: , but you should be able to use

(note the capitalization).

This documentation may help you

text: Thanks I will try those, although I'm not sure what the problem is. Also should I install AbstractPlotting explicitly? The docs say to only install one of the backends  but some examples in the docs like this <https://makie.juliaplots.org/stable/animation.html|one> have `using AbstractPlotting` which fails if only GLMakie is added by the package manager

text: okay thanks clarifying. What about AbstractPlotting? Should I manually add it?

elements.text: okay thanks clarifying. What about AbstractPlotting? Should I manually add it?

text: it's hard to keep the docs completely in sync when doing these major changes :) no you don't need to import AbstractPlotting explicitly, each backend also imports it and exports the relevant functions for most plotting. Sometimes you do need to qualify functions with `AbstractPlotting.somefunc` but then AbstractPlotting is already an exported symbol
